alert.note: Alert for Mariposa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 10 at 9:08PM PDT until June 12 at 10:00AM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Hanford CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Pohono Bridge affecting Mariposa County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Merced River...including Pohono Bridge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING TO LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merced River at Pohono Bridge. * WHEN...From Sunday evening to late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Western portion of North Pines Campground located at the east end of Yosemite Valley between the confluence of the Merced River and Tenaya Creek begins to flood. Water rises to the base of the swinging bridge downstream from Chapel Meadow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM PDT Saturday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.8 feet late tonight. It will then rise to 10.0 feet late tomorrow evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1000 AM PDT.
